Compute a summary table of MCMC estimates and diagnostics

Source: R/fit.R
fit-method-summary.Rd

Run summarise_draws() from the posterior package. For MCMC only post-warmup draws are included in the summary.

Usage

$summary(...)

Arguments

  • ...: Optional arguments to pass to posterior::summarise_draws().

Value

See posterior::summarise_draws().

See also

CmdStanMCMC, CmdStanMLE, CmdStanVB

Examples

# \dontrun{
fit <- cmdstanr_example("logistic")
#> Model executable is up to date!
fit$summary()
#> # A tibble: 5 x 10
#>   variable    mean  median    sd   mad       q5      q95  rhat ess_bulk ess_tail
#>   <chr>      <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 lp__     -65.9   -65.6   1.41  1.23  -68.7    -64.3     1.00    2201.    2896.
#> 2 alpha      0.378   0.377 0.215 0.212   0.0257   0.738   1.00    4068.    2995.
#> 3 beta[1]   -0.664  -0.662 0.250 0.244  -1.09    -0.265   1.00    4421.    3013.
#> 4 beta[2]   -0.276  -0.274 0.226 0.232  -0.653    0.0883  1.00    4042.    3181.
#> 5 beta[3]    0.688   0.681 0.266 0.263   0.253    1.14    1.00    4212.    3444.
fit$summary(c("mean", "sd"))
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>   variable    mean    sd
#>   <chr>      <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 lp__     -65.9   1.41 
#> 2 alpha      0.378 0.215
#> 3 beta[1]   -0.664 0.250
#> 4 beta[2]   -0.276 0.226
#> 5 beta[3]    0.688 0.266
# }
